message.body: How was your ethics class at tech? How is ethics as a subject?

Ethics at tech was cool but mostly a joke. Ethics as a class is cool, you study morality and values and stuff. It can be kinda boring especially when you're reading the greeks, but try to look at the big picture. You usually study Aristotle, Kant, Nietzche and some more modern postmodernist guys. Get ready for round two of your favorite word- deontology!
Lol thanks! Trying to decide if I should take intro to ethics or a more interesting philosophy class
Lmao what are the other choices
Existentialism, intro to logic, bioethics, philosophy of human nature, Phil of art, Phil of law, Phil of social science, mind/brain/self evolution...
Jesus all of those are open to freshmen?!
Yeah! And that's actually a limited selection from all the philosophy classes there are in the department
Damn man you all kinds of lucky. I say stick to ethics, logic or existentialism. Ethics and existentialism are interesting. Logic is easy
